title: Bourbon Street shooting: NOPD names 1 of 2 men arrested on gun charges
content:
New Orleans police have identified one of two men arrested early Sunday (Nov. 27) on gun charges following the Bourbon Street mass shooting that police say killed one man and wounded nine other people.
Shelvin Gray, 19, was one of the two arrested Sunday and booked with illegal possession of a firearm, the NOPD confirmed.
NOPD spokesman Tyler Gamble said that there have been no charges in connection with the shooting at this time.
Two men were arrested on charges of illegal carrying of a weapon, including one victim in the shooting, NOPD said.
The other arrested man, who has not been named by police, was wounded in the shooting, which occurred shortly before 1:40 a.m. near the corner of Bourbon and Iberville streets. Earlier Sunday, police said the unnamed man was being treated for his injuries. Police did not indicate the severity of the man's injuries.
New Orleans police did not say the men were suspected to be the shooter or shooters in the incident.
